p: Zika virus (ZIKV) is a single-stranded RNA virus and belongs to the Flavivirus genus and Flaviviridae family.[ 1 2] Phylogenetically, ZIKV is linked to African and the Asian lineage, with the latter related to the recent Latin American epidemic.[ 3 4] The year of 1947 marks the isolation of ZIKV from a surveillant macaque in the course of yellow fever surveillance in Uganda's Zika forests, thus, deriving the name of the virus.[ 5] Soon after, the virus was isolated in the same forest in Aedes africanus mosquitoes.[ 6]
